author: parithosh
content: <@&898338229407870986> could you guys have a look at your nodes and see if there's any optimisation needed or if this is just the sync speed expected?

author: parithosh
content: Sync aggregate % is still significantly below what we'd expect for the given participation rate, does someone have any theories there?

author: radekkapka
content: Hey, I know the reason. Some time ago I noticed the same on a small local devnet and so I decided to check what happens when you run 4 nodes for a single client with 16 keys each. LH, Teku and Nimbus have perfect sync committee participation, Lodestar has 34.38% for each block and Prysm has 50%/75%/100% blocks. I have a fix for Prysm almost ready and it will definitely ship with the next release: https://github.com/OffchainLabs/prysm/pull/15608. The impact of our bug should be minimal on Mainnet, but I expect sync committee participation to improve slightly with this change because we might be missing aggregation opportunities. I can't speak for Lodestar.

author: radekkapka
content: cc <@&595681771690000403> - is your 34.38% sync committee participation that I observed a devnet-only issue or is there a real bug somewhere that can impact Mainnet as well?

author: parithosh
content:
